casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Abraham SOMERMAN, Max Markowitz, Nathan Mansdorf, and William Marks, Defendants-Appellants. No. 194. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Nov. 20, 1933. Slade & Slade, of New York City, for appellants Abraham Somerman and Max Markowitz. Sanford H. Cohen, of New York City, for appellants Nathan Mansdorf and William Marks. George Z. Medaiie, U. S. Atty., of New York City (William B. Herlands, Asst. U. S. Atty., of New York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before MANTON, AUGUSTUS N. HAND, and CHASE, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed.
